hints: A chase game.
One person is 'it'.
Yelling 'you're it' is common.
A game of stealth and counting.
One person closes their eyes and counts to a number.
The goal is to find everyone.
A simple team sport.
Played on a baseball diamond.
A large red rubber ball is used.
A game played with a ball in a divided court.
The court is a large square divided into four smaller ones.
A game of volleying with your hands.
You draw a pattern on the ground.
You toss a small object into a square.
You jump on one or two feet.
Two teams and two flags.
The goal is to steal the other team's flag.
Often played in a wooded area.
A game of throwing and dodging.
The goal is to hit opponents with a ball.
If you catch the ball, a teammate can return.
You have to stop and go.
The leader faces away from the group.
You must freeze when the leader says 'red light'.
An activity with a long cord.
You swing the rope over your head and under your feet.
Also known as skipping.
A ball attached to a pole with a rope.
Two players try to wrap the ball around the pole.
It is commonly found at school playgrounds.
You follow clues to find items.
A game of exploration.
The first to find all items wins.
A team sport using a spherical ball.
The most popular sport in the world.
You can't use your hands.
A bat and a ball are needed.
The team with the most runs wins.
Played on a diamond.
You dribble a ball.
You score points by shooting through a hoop.
Popular street game.
A game with an oval shaped ball.
Two teams try to advance the ball down the field.
Popular American sport.
Two teams hit a ball over a net.
The ball can be hit no more than three times per side.
Can be played on a beach.
You throw a plastic disc.
A popular backyard toss game.
Can be played with a dog.
You use a racket and a shuttlecock.
Played over a net.
The shuttlecock is also known as a birdie.
A sport played with rackets and a small ball.
Played on a rectangular court.
Often played as singles or doubles.
You hit a small ball with a club.
The goal is to get the ball into a hole.
Played on a large green course.
A game involving hitting balls with a mallet.
You hit the balls through hoops.
Played on a lawn.
An Italian lawn game.
Players throw larger balls at a smaller ball.
The smaller target ball is called the pallino.
Also known as bean bag toss.
Players throw bags at a raised board.
A hole in the board is worth points.
A pitching game.
You throw a U-shaped object.
The goal is to get the object around a stake.
Also known as bolo toss.
Players toss a bola at a three-rung ladder.
The bolo is two balls connected by a string.
A popular summer game.
Players stand opposite each other and throw a filled balloon.
You try not to get wet.
A water toy.
A long, slick surface to slide on.
You run and then dive on to it.
A swimming pool game.
One person closes their eyes and calls out a name.
Everyone else must reply to the call.
A large-scale version of a block game.
You remove a block from the tower and place it on top.
The goal is to not let the tower fall.
A two-person race.
One person holds the other's legs.
The person on their hands 'walks' to the finish line.
A race with a partner.
Two people's inner legs are tied together.
You must work together to run.
You have to jump to the finish line.
Each person is in a large bag.
Often a classic field day event.
You act out a word or phrase without speaking.
A game of miming.
Can be played with teams.
A real-world treasure hunt.
You use a GPS to find a container.
Often involves logging your find online.
You look for things like a pinecone or a green leaf.
An educational game for kids.
Often played on a hiking trail.
A classic winter activity.
You throw packed snow at friends.
Sometimes you build a fort.
You slide down a snowy hill.
You sit or lie on a vehicle of some sort.
Also known as tobogganing.
You glide on a frozen surface.
You wear special footwear with blades.
Can be done at a rink or frozen pond.
You roll three large balls of snow.
You use a carrot for a nose.
You add buttons for a face.
A version of football without tackling.
You 'tackle' by tapping the opponent.
A safer way to play the game.
A version of football without tackling.
You 'tackle' by grabbing a piece of cloth off the opponent's waist.
A popular sport in schools.
A non-contact team sport.
You score by catching the disc in the opponent's end zone.
A mix of soccer and football with a flying disc.
Also known as disc golf.
You throw a disc at a metal basket.
It has a similar scoring system to a popular club sport.
A simple game for two people.
You throw and receive a ball.
It helps improve hand-eye coordination.
A game of tag and hide-and-seek.
One person is 'it' and guards a can.
If you are found, you are 'in jail' until a teammate kicks the can.
A game of following a leader's instructions.
Players ask for permission to move forward.
The leader's goal is to be unpredictable.
A game of following a leader's commands.
You must only follow commands preceded by a special name.
If you follow a command without the special name, you're out.
A game for young children.
Players sit in a circle.
One player walks around and taps heads.
A classic mystery game.
The 'murderer' secretly winks at people.
If you are winked at, you must 'die' dramatically.
The five D's of a popular ball sport.
The rules are often made up as you go.
A game of throwing and avoiding.
An artistic activity on pavement.
Uses a dusty, colored stick.
Often a childhood activity.
A game of swimming and avoiding.
One person is 'it' and tries to tag others.
You try to stay out of the 'shark's' path.
Two teams linked by hands.
One team calls for a player from the other side.
The called player tries to break the human chain.
You walk around a row of seats.
When the music stops, you find a seat.
One chair is removed each round.
A game of jumping over people.
One person bends down and the next jumps over them.
You create a chain of people.
Two teams on opposite ends of a rope.
You pull with all your strength.
The goal is to pull the other team across a line.
A race where you waddle.
You hold an object between your knees.
You cannot use your hands to hold the object.
A lawn game with large, wooden blocks.
The blocks are marked with dots.
You try to match the numbers on the blocks.
A large game of strategy.
Played on a big board on the ground.
The pieces are large circles.
A large game of strategy.
The pieces are often taller than people.
Played on a board in a garden or park.
A classic carnival game.
You throw a ring at a pole or bottle.
The goal is to get the ring around the target.
A V-shaped throwing tool.
The goal is for it to return to you.
A traditional Australian hunting tool.
An activity with soap and a wand.
A popular outdoor activity for kids.
The bubbles float and pop.
A game played with a ball and numbers.
One person throws a ball up and yells a number.
Players try to catch the ball.
A variation of baseball.
Uses a light plastic ball with holes.
A plastic bat is often used.
A sport played on a large grass area.
Players try to roll balls as close as possible to a smaller ball.
Also known as 'bowls'.
A sport that combines frisbee with a popular club sport.
Players throw a disc at a metal basket.
The goal is to complete each hole in the fewest throws.
An action sport involving a board with wheels.
You can perform tricks on it.
Often done in a park or on the street.
A sport that involves wearing boots with wheels.
Can be done on pavement or at a rink.
You can go very fast.
A game similar to kick the can.
The cone is the object you're trying to kick.
One person is 'it' and guards the cone.
A summer activity with water.
You use a handheld device to spray others.
The goal is to soak your friends.
A nursery rhyme and a game.
Players hold hands and walk in a circle.
Everyone falls down at the end.
A reverse hide and seek.
One person hides, and everyone else tries to find them.
Once you find the person, you hide with them.
A game of tag.
One person is 'it' and has a 'poison dart'.
If you are tagged, you must hold the spot where you were hit.
A team sport with a disc.
You score by catching the disc in the end zone.
Players cannot run with the disc.
A racket sport.
You hit a shuttlecock over a net.
The shuttlecock is also known as a birdie.
A sport played on a baseball diamond.
The pitcher rolls a large red ball to the batter.
You kick the ball instead of hitting it with a bat.
A bat and ball game.
Popular in Commonwealth countries.
Played on a pitch.
A team sport with a stick and a ball.
The stick has a mesh pocket on the end.
Known as the fastest game on two feet.
A team sport played with a stick and a ball.
The stick has a curved end.
Played on a grass or artificial turf field.
A team sport with an oval shaped ball.
Similar to American football but with different rules.
Players try to run with the ball to score a 'try'.
A team sport on horseback.

The field is called a polo field.
A team sport played in a pool.
Players tread water while trying to score.

A competition in the water.
You try to get from one side of the pool to the other as fast as you can.
The goal is to beat the clock or other people.
